title: 111_s1520
content: CHAPTER 1504 - NATIONAL AMERICAN INDIAN VETERANS, INCORPORATED: This section recognizes National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated as a corporation and grants them a federal charter under Part B of title 36, United States Code. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated is a federally chartered nonprofit corporation with purposes that include upholding and defending the Constitution of the United States while respecting the sovereignty of American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian Nations. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated aims to unite American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian veterans, advocate for their needs, promote social welfare, and support their growth and development. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated aims to advocate for the needs of American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian veterans, promote research on their relationship with American society, and provide technical assistance to tribes without veterans committees or organizations. Membership eligibility and rights are determined by the corporation's constitution and by-laws, while the board of directors oversees the organization's operations. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated focuses on advocating for the needs of American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian veterans. Membership eligibility and rights are determined by the corporation's constitution and by-laws, while the board of directors oversees the organization's operations. Training and educating Tribal Veterans Service Officers for Tribes in need is also a key focus. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated operates in accordance with its constitution and bylaws, ensuring non-discrimination based on various factors. The corporation's powers are limited to those granted by its articles of incorporation and laws. It holds exclusive rights to specific names, seals, emblems, and badges. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated has exclusive rights to specific names, seals, emblems, and badges. The corporation is restricted from issuing stock or paying dividends. Income or assets cannot benefit members, officers, or directors, except for approved compensation and expenses. Loans to any internal party are prohibited, and the corporation cannot claim federal endorsement. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated is restricted from issuing stock or paying dividends. It is prohibited from making loans to internal parties and claiming federal endorsement. The corporation must maintain its tax-exempt status and keep accurate records for inspection. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated must maintain records of members with voting rights and allow inspection of books and records by members or their representatives. The corporation must comply with jurisdictional laws regarding service of process and is liable for acts of officers and agents. The corporation must comply with jurisdictional laws for service of process and is liable for acts of officers and agents. Failure to comply with requirements may result in the expiration of the charter. The corporation is also required to submit an annual report to Congress detailing its activities. The charter granted by this chapter shall expire if the corporation fails to comply with jurisdictional laws. The corporation must submit an annual report to Congress detailing its activities. The charter granted by this chapter shall expire if the corporation fails to comply with jurisdictional laws. The corporation must submit an annual report to Congress detailing its activities. National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated is referenced as "1504" in the context.
